item.title: Accessing localhost from a Docker Container using native Docker for Mac
item.description: Ever had a need to access something from within a Docker container that runs on the host system? When using native Docker on OSX you have bad luck. When configuring a container and pointing that to localhost will result in the fact the your software will be targeted at the localhost of the docker container. A solution for this isto define a new local loopback to your localhost $ sudo ifconfig lo0 alias 172.

item.title: Installing Markdown on OSX and use it inside VIM
item.description: Back again to one of my favorites which is called Markdown. Once every now and then i forget how easy it is. Normally i use Textmate to do all my writing, but recently i have picked up VIM to do some editing etc. Why i did chose VIM? I will not trouble you with that decision :) Using Textmate everything is easy, but when you want to use Markdown inside VIM it is somewhat different.
